The SÅ«tra of Great Skillful Means of Repaying Kindness, in 7 fascicles, clarifies the two knowledges.
The first five fascicles explain the stages of abiding to repay kindness.
The sixth fascicle explains the Buddha's relatives, the year and month of his birth, and the length of his life.
It also states that without accepting the three refuges and five precepts, one cannot attain a human body.

The preface briefly states:
Dharmaká¹£ema Fashi said that the chapters and sections of the Jinguangming jing were incomplete.
Every time I examined the text and contemplated the meaning,
I thought that there was evidence for this statement.
But when I compared it, there was no reference. I always remembered it in my dreams.
In the same year of the Liang Wudi era, the court issued an edict to send Zhang Ji and others as envoys.
Translated by the Tripiá¹­aka Master PrabhÄkaramitra of India,
and brought the scriptures and treatises. He respectfully received the imperial decree.
In the first year of the Taiching era, he translated the list of scriptures.

Among them, there are also the Silver Lord DhÄraá¹‡Ä« Chapter and the Entrustment Chapter.
The Dharma Master translated them.
The Å›ramaá¹‡a Yanzong re-examined them.

The chapters and sections are complete, starting from here.
